Accessed on 2008-07-02. | population_total = 1223223 | population_as_of = 2008 | population_density_km2 = auto | population_demonym = | timezone1 = CET | utc_offset1 = +01 | iso_code = DZ-17 | area_code_type = Area Code | area_code = +213 (0) 27 | blank_name_sec1 = Districts | blank_info_sec1 = 12 | blank1_name_sec1 = Municipalities | blank1_info_sec1 = 36 | website = | footnotes = }} Djelfa is a province of Algeria. The capital is Djelfa. There are over 1.2 million people. Important towns are Tadmit, El Khemis, and Selmana. ==Division== The province has 12 districts. There are also 36 communes or municipalities. ===Districts=== # Aïn El Ibil # Aïn Oussera # Birine # Charef # Dar Chioukh # Djelfa # El Idrissia # Faidh El Botma # Had Sahary # Hassi Bahbah # Messaâd # Sidi Ladjel ==References== Category:Provinces of Algeria
title: Djelfa Province
